case_circumstances: Body was found is wooded area near Wiltnych Rural Cemetery
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body:
One pair of green and b
lack, plad trousers with pleats. An identifying label is present on the inner aspect of the garment which reads: "Pure New Wool" in English and three other languages. The reverse of the label reads "Size 98". No fabric defects are present on the pants. Another label is present on the waistband which reads: "Rene" Lezard: Femme & Home".
case_clothing_with_body:
A pair of brief white underwear with red stripes. A faded label is present along the inner aspect of the brief underwear.

A torquoise-colored, polo shirt with short sleeves. An identifying label is present in the inner aspect of the collar which read: "Chemise Lacoste" with a logo in the design of a profile of an alligator.
case_footwear: Pair of black loafers. The word "hikers" is printed on the sole of the right shoe. The sole of the shoe is worn. The number "9" printed on the inner aspect of the sole of the shoe. The top of the shoes have black tassles. A pair of white socks with dark blue and light blue stripes covered by an abundant amount of fly larvae
case_jewelry:
A soft, black, leather wallet, appearing to be of good quality, is presnt in the back pocket of the pants. The wallet contains a "1988 Comerzbank Calender". Yellow metal crucifix with chain.

A colored photograph of a white causcasian male with long, wavy, brown hair, wearing a green sweater and holding a white infant with a spoon in his mouth and a bib on his chest. 

Gold-covered wrist watch, type "Bulova Quartz" The back of the watch does not have inscriptions.

One thin, delicate, yellow-metallic, chain necklace with a clasp wrapped aroung the decedent's neck. A bronze-colored cross is also attached to the chain.
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
